name: Mixer
protips: Pro-tip: Grab a drink if you need some time to regroup.
Chat about the refreshments if you need a conversation topic.
Pro-tip: Commenting on refreshments can be a good conversation starter.
Pro-tip: Ask if you can join a group conversation.
Pro-tip: Take a seat if your tired, you can still have conversations sitting.
instructions: Tap on the people with food
Tap on the people with drinks
Tap on the people in groups of 3
reminders: Reminder: Get something to drink if you need a break.
Reminder: You can always ask what someone thinks of the food.
Reminder: You can always ask what someone thinks of the food.
Reminder: You can always ask to join in a group conversation.
Congrats! You’ve completed the challenge.

name: Meetup
protips: Pro-tip: Smiling people are usually more welcoming.
Pro-tip: People by themselves are more likely to start up a conversation.
Pro-tip: Commenting on refreshments can be a good conversation starter.
Pro-tip: Looking for groups who are similar to you can help break the ice.
Pro-tip: Being aware of your surroundings can help ground you.
instructions: Tap on all the smiling faces
reminders: Reminder: Find the smiling people!
Reminder: Find a lone person and strike up a converstation.
Reminder: Talking about your surroundings can be a good icebreaker.
Reminder: If you’re nervous try finding people who look similiar to you
Congrats! You’ve completed the challenge.

name: Zoom Call
protips: Pro-tip: Muting your microphone helps others focus on the speaker.
Pro-tip: Not smiling could sometimes mean the person is listening intently.
Pro-tip: Couples on calls usually have one person who’s chattier than the other. Try to engage both in the conversation!
Pro-tip: Complimenting someone’s background can be a good conversation starter.
Pro-tip: Zoom calls can sometimes have unexpected surprises.
reminders: Reminder: Mute your mic!
Reminder: Not smiling does not neccessarily mean the person is bored.
Reminder: Try to engage both members in a couple in conversation.
Reminder: Talking about your surroundings can be a good icebreaker.
Congrats! You’ve completed the challenge.

name: Coffee Chat
protips: Pro-tip: Active listeners face the speaker, nod or hold eye contact, and rest their hands to the side.
Pro-tip: During professional coffee chats, try to avoid messy food.
Pro-tip: Effective hand gestures can make the conversation more engaging.
Pro-tip: Try to find a quiet table away from any distractions.
Pro-tip: If you’re familiar with someone you can compliment their outfit.
instructions: Click on the food and drinks
Tap on the person wearing glasses
reminders: Reminder: Active listening helps you to ask questions and continue the conversation.
Reminder: If you’re going to eat, avoid making a mess.
Reminder: Hand gestures can make a conversation more animated.
Reminder: Find ways to eliminate distractions in a busy area.
Congrats! You’ve completed the challenge.
